Key Match Events: The game went into extra innings tied at one.
Each team scored in the 10th as Chicago’s Korey Lee scored on Vargas’ sacrifice fly and Los Angeles’ Gustavo Campero had an RBI base hit.
The teams again traded runs in the 11th on RBI singles by the White Sox Andrew Benintendi and Wagaman.
The Angels had the bases loaded in the 10th and 12th innings but were finally able to walk it off in the 13th.

Wagaman was the automatic runner on second base and advanced to third on Logan O'Hoppe's ground ball to right field. With the infield drawn in, Adams hit a sharp grounder off Jairo Iriarte (0-1) that Vargas wasn't able to field cleanly, giving the Angels their fifth walk-off victory of the season.
Pre-Game Insights: Interim manager Grady Sizemore said, “We get the same question every day, we're focused on one series at a time and one game at a time. Everything else is irrelevant right now.”
Post-Match Reflections: Angels manager Ron Washington said, “We had opportunities throughout the game to do something, we just couldn’t stretch that run, especially in extra innings. But we kept going and finally caught a break.”
Adams said, “I was just trying to put it in play and give the runner at third a chance to score.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox have hit nine home runs over the last five games after recording just six in the previous 13 contests.
Andrew Vaughn led off the fourth inning with his team-tying 19th home run.
The White Sox have the 117th loss of the season, which is tied for the third most losses since 1900.
The White Sox need to go 7-2 in their final nine games to avoid the post-1900 record of 120 losses by the 1962 expansion New York Mets.
Others: The game was played in Anaheim, Calif.
The White Sox begin a three-game series at San Diego on Friday.
The Angels head to Houston for a four-game weekend series.
